intro: Jacksonia flexuosa, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often used in traditional Māori weaving due to its strong, fibrous leaves. Jacksonia flexuosa is also valued for its ornamental qualities in gardens.
